smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (millisecondsInOneDay * days) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: millisecondsInOneDay * days
Parentheses in (foundIndex) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: foundIndex
Parentheses in (activities.size > 0) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: activities.size > 0

Parentheses in (ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context,
                    Manifest.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &&

                    ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context,
                            Manifest.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context,
                    Manifest.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &&

                    ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context,
                            Manifest.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED

Parentheses in (grantResults.isNotEmpty() &&
                            grantResults[0] == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &&
                            grantResults[1] == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: grantResults.isNotEmpty() &&
                            grantResults[0] == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &&
                            grantResults[1] == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED
Parentheses in (System.currentTimeMillis() > dateTimeWithSufficientTimeElapsed) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: System.currentTimeMillis() > dateTimeWithSufficientTimeElapsed
Parentheses in (Index(value = ["name"], unique = true)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Index(value = ["name"], unique = true)

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

smells.name: ForbiddenComment
smells.description: Flags a forbidden comment. Defaults values are TODO:, FIXME: or STOPSHIP:

smells.name: UtilityClassWithPublicConstructor
smells.description: The class declaration is unnecessary because it only contains utility functions. An object declaration should be used instead.

instances.message: The class PermissionHandler only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `localLastA to localLastB`

smells.name: LoopWithTooManyJumpStatements
smells.description: The loop contains more than one break or continue statement. The code should be refactored to increase readability.

The loop contains more than one break or continue statement. The code should be refactored to increase readability.

smells.name: FunctionOnlyReturningConstant
smells.description: A function that only returns a constant is misleading. Consider declaring a constant instead

instances.message: getBaseUrl is returning a constant. Prefer declaring a constant instead.
